newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Dainong, Midopa shrs hit limit high.
newsitem.headline: Dainong, Midopa shrs hit limit high.

text.p: South Korea's Dainong Corp and Midopa Department Store went limit up in early Wednesday trading on news that its parent Dainong Group had agreed to cede management rights of both firms, brokers said.
Dainong was also the most heavily trading stock of the morning with 237,730 shares changing hands.
Dainong shares surged to the daily limit high of 3,440 won, up 250 won, while Midopa stocks rose to 8,200 won, up 600.
"Investors are buying up the shares of Dainong and Midopa on news that they'll be able to get the emergency loans," said Koh Kyung-bae of Hyundai Securities.
However, brokers said the rally was unlikely to continue long.
"They could slip back as early as in the afternoon," Koh said. --Seoul Newsroom (822) 727 5643
